data.name: Find The Poisoned Apple
data.description:
### Help the wicked witch!!

Given a binary tree, return the `id` of the branch containing THE ONLY poisoned apple.

Each node has the following structure:

```javascript
Node {
  id: int (>= 0)
  poisoned: true/false
  (optional) left: Node || null
  (optional) right: Node || null
}
```
```haskell
data Tree = Null
          | Node { id :: Int
                 , poisoned :: Bool
                 , left :: Tree
                 , right :: Tree
                 }
```

```if:javascript
An empty left or right node either has a null value or is altogether missing from the object.  
If no poisoned apple is on the tree return `-1`.
```
```if:haskell
If no poisoned apple is on the tree return `Nothing`.  
Note that `Apple.Preloaded.id` clashes with `Prelude.id` when unqualified ( and vice versa ). We apologise for the inconvenience.
```
